main event: Two bright, erratic star-like objects were observed in the sky near Tularosa, New Mexico on August 31, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were seen immediately after a scheduled balloon release.
One of the objects was described as perfectly stationary, while the other was approaching at a tremendous speed.
The objects disappeared from view after the witnesses drove into a cut in the mountain.
The remaining object was seen descending at a much greater rate than an airplane or any other known object.
A map or diagram showed the location of the sighting relative to the Roswell Radar Station and the Albuquerque Air Defense Identification Zone.
